k-lor.gloss: salt of potassium (KCl) (trade names K-Dur 20, Kaochlor and K-lor and Klorvess and K-lyte)

k-lyte.gloss: salt of potassium (KCl) (trade names K-Dur 20, Kaochlor and K-lor and Klorvess and K-lyte)

klaipeda.gloss: a city in western Lithuania on the Baltic Sea

klamath.gloss: a river flowing southwest from Oregon through northern California to the Pacific Ocean

klamath river.gloss: a river flowing southwest from Oregon through northern California to the Pacific Ocean

klammath weed.gloss: yellow-flowered perennial common in fields and waste places but a weed in rangelands

klan.gloss: a secret society of white Southerners in the United States

klansman.gloss: a member of the Ku Klux Klan

klaproth.gloss: German chemist who pioneered analytical chemistry and discovered three new elements (1743-1817)

klaus fuchs.gloss: British physicist who was born in Germany and fled Nazi persecution

klavier.gloss: a stringed instrument that has a keyboard

klaxon.gloss: a kind of loud horn formerly used on motor vehicles

klebs-loeffler bacillus.gloss: a species of bacterium that causes diphtheria

klein.gloss: German mathematician who created the Klein bottle (1849-1925)
United States psychoanalyst (born in Austria) who was the first to specialize in the psychoanalysis of small children (1882-1960)
United States fashion designer noted for understated fashions (born in 1942)

kleist.gloss: German dramatist whose works concern people torn between reason and emotion (1777-1811)

synonyms.word: prince klemens wenzel nepomuk lothar von metternich

klick.gloss: a metric unit of length equal to 1000 meters (or 0.621371 miles)

klimt.gloss: Austrian painter influenced by art nouveau (1862-1918)

klinefelter.gloss: United States physician who first described the XXY-syndrome (born in 1912)

klinefelter's syndrome.gloss: syndrome in males that is characterized by small testes and long legs and enlarged breasts and reduced sperm production and mental retardation

klinefelter syndrome.gloss: syndrome in males that is characterized by small testes and long legs and enlarged breasts and reduced sperm production and mental retardation

klorvess.gloss: salt of potassium (KCl) (trade names K-Dur 20, Kaochlor and K-lor and Klorvess and K-lyte)

klotho.gloss: the Greek goddess of fate who spins the thread of life

kluxer.gloss: a member of the Ku Klux Klan
